bow: mommit need help dealing with my well meaning mil in regards to minor issue what is the best way to deal with family member who likes to buy useless or one use items as gifts my mil is being very thoughtful and loves buying stuff for her kids and now grandchild more often than not we end up with things we are going to use or that just take up space should mention that she has no concept of clutter she and my fil probably still have everything they have ever brought ever as well as stuff that other people were getting rid of currently know they are on their way down with 25 year old little tykes slide that her youngest son had her kitchen is over flowing with gadgets that are for one specific function last time she was out here she randomly got us salt block for cooking food on it is neat but pointles and takes up space we barely have room for the things we do use let alone something that we will use once as gimmick would like to nip this in the bud now before it becomes bigger issue with my daughter but want to do so as nicely as possible know she is just being thoughtful so do want to insult her she can sometimes take things the wrong way and be very passive aggressive about it edit as this is getting bigger than expected am going to start listing some of the suggestions from below for the people coming here for that reason being honest and forward about not needing things many below have tried this and it has either worked with mixed results or has worked at all eventually you may just need to gently hurt feelings by returning items to stores donating them to goodwill or flat out sending them back with the giver have them keep the toys at their house this would work especially well if you are visiting them lot or your child stays there lot in our case they are hours away so it is good option especially since we are trying to keep them from adding mroestuff to their over filled house divert the energy from buying things into somethine else experiences such as memberships to museums or zoos were one way to do this we belong to fine arts museum that has art classes from infants on up and so far they have been fun we may try and ask for gift certificates towards her classes college funds such as 529 plans that anyone can contribute to was another suggestion flat out tell them exactly what you need as one person said know you are awesome with finding things at garage sales we could really use call me if you see one if they are the type that likes to buy things for people they will likely just pay for it themselves do have the answer but if you figure it out please let me know mine does something similar she buys things that seem useful but in iterations that make them not very useful or worse things we already have like navy blue throw pillows there nothing navy in my whole house and piles and piles of blankets that are too small for bed but too big for throw on the couch or kitchen gadgets that already own who needs two food grinders not me the thing ve noticed is that she does think much about what we might really want or need instead she sees something that she likes and would buy for herself and assumes that everyone else would also want it have yet to figure out how to address it so we just collect these things until do goodwill purge my mothers in law have both buy tons of stuff yet both deplore clutter and both agree with me that it would be great if dear son had less crap but they keep buying and so does my husband the three of them do go week without adding to the toy horde and they all want me to cull down if you figure out the secret please share have very sweet and well meaning mil who also will not stop with the constant barrage of stuff not just for the grand kid either she shops discount stores and will pick up random stuff for me or my husband as well almost every visit to her house come back with large shopping bag of stuff process the stuff as follows some things will never be used they immediately get posted to kijiji aka craigslist lot of the time post the stuff as free sometimes post it for bargain price examples new with tags clothes that are too large husband and have lost weight mil still buys our old sizes or has stockpiles of stuff in our old sizes also sold three of the six snowsuits that mil bought for our son last year some things can replace other things we already have new toy dump truck means that one of the older or less used dump trucks can go some things we might get one or two uses out of then they too go on kijiji if mil gave us little tykes slide probably let our son play with it for day or two and then give it away after the novelty wore off the really nice useful or meaningful things are kept and used know that selling or giving away gifts can feel wrong but this process has come about after we ve made it clear that all this stuff is too much and causes us stress and makes us unhappy mil enjoys the giving but does have lot of expectations about what we will do with the stuff she is not the type of person to visit and mention oh where is the fantastic item gave you and expect us to bring it forward with flourish and gushing as long as you ve taken an opportunity to tell her that the stuff is bit too much and as long as she not going to be weird if she ever finds out the stuff was donated to family that needed it more than us then say let it go let it go sorry do have any advice either usually just talk openly about how love clutter free house and make point to bring up when doing dejunking donations in case they want to take anything to their church or something but hoping someone else does because my mil sounds exactly the same as yours they bought my daughter coins one christmas none of us collect coins and they know how feel about thing they have saved every single thing they ve ever owned not exaggerating is it possible to politely refuse to take it do let them unload it explain there no room for it would they please store it at their house for lo to play with when you re all visiting lo would love to have such special thing at their house etc if there no way to get them to not bring it down feel like the point of no return is unloading the slide do not let them unload the slide alternatively if the item is worth anything maybe wait until they leave and then take it to thrift shop thankfully she is hours away and ca possibly drop things on us weekly if they lived closer and they may soetime in the future eeek think am going to impose rule or have my husband do it that she runs bigger things by us first unfortunately if there is space to fill in their house it is filled it is hoarder bad well maybe the basement and freezer is because it is very liveable but we ca take the stance in reference to clutter maybe someone will have magic answer think this is part of the case as well she loves gadgets and if she sees something she wants for herself and has already spent too much on herself or already has something similar buying things for her children is the next best thing think there are only two polite options here one you keep accepting the stuff and quietly donate it when she is looking if she is that big of clutter bug would imagine she would notice when things are there two you ask your husband to talk to her about it my husband and have pretty serious rule that deal with my parents and he deals with his if one or the other of us has an issue then the adult child will go to that parent not the in law if that makes sense if your mil is super passive aggressive it would definitely be best to have her son talk to her rather than you no matter what she may be offended but it would probably be worse if you approached her about it oh know the thing about saving everything it partly comes from the fact that they came from poor families this includes taking anything that could possibly be useful from jobs that are getting tossed my dad was the same way in less sever form they literally have boxes of old old computer keyboards cabinets fridge freezer and closets are stuffed to the brim well the slide is so that we have control over its use in the case that it is unsafe we thought about leaving it there for our lo but if we have it we can throw it away and it is another thing out of their house my sil will throw things away when she is visiting them and are not home if the slide is safe and honestly think it is we will actually use it just ca beleive they have kept it this long other things tend to be things that ca be returned like from craft shows or the like so it is hard to make her take it back but think we are going to get to that point think the difference is that she has ton of expectations about what we are going to do with the stuff she will periodically ask about some things think changing her expectations about what will be done with the items is probably where we need to start also six snowsuits we have that rule as well when dealing with parents just need to find way that he should approach her about it and then can back it up with actions or polite comments as things happen there are some items she will ask about am not the type to dress up my child for every holiday again it goes back to things that only get used once and she gets put off if forget to take picture of something like patty day outfit she got wish had solution to this my mil is hoarder and over gifter every time we see her she has gifts which typically consist of old things she found in her home that are loaded with sentimental value according to her the first year or so with my now husband let myself feel guilty and over polite about this stuff but at this point ve crossed over to arguably rude distant because anything else just encourages more now just say thank you and always include you should have you really did have too etc some examples of things gifted to us my husband baby bottles for us to use with our baby no scratched up pleather purse from the 80s was once left on our front stoop as birthday present she once saw an off hand comment made about color dye in baby tylenol staining clothes on facebook and mailed me coke bottles filled with ionized water from her faucet because it will get stains out not ever letting us leave without taking old food eh it goes on know sounded really dispassionate about this stuff but after so many years of it know there no way to get her to stop and the only way to minimize it is to not feed into it yes threw away the water bottles yes put the purse in the goodwill pile no have not eaten any of the food sure as hell am not using 30 year old bottles to feed my baby and no not gon na drop everything to call her back every time she leaves passive agressive voicemail about how she getting rid of terribly important due to sentimentality thing we do need if we do come get it wow just have to say it nice to find so many other people who are dealing with this issue my mil is very sweet generous woman who loves giving she also hoarder and discount store shopper we live two hours apart so she only gets to give my son and my husband and me gifts when we drive up to visit we usually end up with three or four large paper bags full of things we will literally never use that we have to pack into our already cramped car once month things like clothing in the wrong sizes three or four pairs of shoes for each of us random magazines or knick knacks with things that she thinks we like on them expired food or candy she got on sale plus bag usually full of dusty old stuff she dug out of her house oh and something for the dog every time we see her this has been serious point of contention between my husband and for while he wants to take things home sort through them and then return whatever we do want to his mom the next month yes she expects us to return things we recently decided we would just start giving things away immediately instead now check the bags take the one or two items worth keeping and give the rest to charity am planning on letting her know do this so that maybe she ll realize most of her gifts are just being donated it not great solution but it all have for now wish you luck op this is totally my grandmother it it her greatest source of pride in her life to be able to give gifts to her family members she is at the age where trying to get her to change what is essentially her personality is pretty pointless try to minimize damage by casually mentioning the things that we do need if she is going to spend money rather actually get things need want sometimes pose it as challenge to her shopping skills such as know you are awesome with finding things at garage sales we could really use call me if you see one she will always end up paying for it herself rather than take my money but do make fuss about it way she can still satisfy her urge for bargains and for gifting omg yes this is spot on meanwhile the complete opposite they always comment on how my home is so tidy it like they do make the connection that saving everything you come across=messy house borderline hoarding well they are just not as gross as the shows beautiful home filled with shit everywhere gt beautiful home filled with shit everywhere yup and totally not child safe at this point there are definately things we need but do feel comfortable pointing them in that direction out of the blue especially since we do not talk much outside of text if they asked if we needed something that would be great know they would get anything for us anytime we so much as mention to each other around them how something might be neat suddenly we have one from them before we have even decided if we really want need it have steamer have never used in my closet we do do that anymore oh my goodness ca even imagine bottles of water from the faucet know about old food she brought hamburger meat from her freezer that was years old at one point for us to cook one visit that was probably one of the easier things to get from the freezer they have huge freezer packed as packed as you can get it and ca imagine how old the stuff in the back is have no qualms about returning baby clothing to the store in the correct size wish she would ask before buying them we are always onto buying the next size or size after the current one being worn if they ever go through their house in the spirit of decluttering ca imagine what they will try to give all of us think there are few ways to handle it if you visit their home frequently ask that they please keep these gifts at their house as grandma toys tell them that you appreciate how incredibly generous they are but that your personal preference for your own home is to keep your possessions to minimum talk about how for you when you feel that you have too many items in your home even if you think they might be useful it causes you stress for this reason you try to buy items that are multi use and only keep things that you use frequently do use the words useless or crowded or clutter as these will be seen as negatives also make it very personal focus on yourself in this conversation and talk about how while you think all of the gadgets and one use items are cool and can be very useful you just do have the room for it and again having too many possessions makes you stressed because you personally ca keep it organized do give the impression that you feel that her home is unorganized or cluttered or over crowded even though it is ask them to divert their funds into larger more expensive gift for your daughter that can be given to her on holiday or her birthday or even just straight up cash that can go into college fund have 529 account for my kids and outside people with the account number can donate to it if all else fails just dump the junk sell stuff you can make money from donate stuff you ca but is usable to others and toss the junk she going to just keep giving you crap and you have to keep your house clean and clutter free so this way she is happy and so are you will it hurt her feelings if when she goes to give it to you you just say wow that looks really cool cute fun etc but honestly we just do have the room for it and do see us using it enough for it to be worth storing in our limited space find that pointing them in the direction of needed items works best tell them what you do need or do want from time to time it helps to ensure you do have as much crap everywhere they want to help and buy and supply so get them to get the things you need or want they feel needed and wanted and you do have basket full of not needed gadgets and be honest with them when you truly do need something no need to be passive here be up front it might but think it is something we are going to have to start doing my mothers in law both live accross the country my son thinks ups and fedex rock lol have let my mom and mom in law know that have issues with stuff and that need to cut down for my own sanity they ve tried to quell it but know it makes them happy to give so ve just been transparent with the fact that will not keep stuff around if do need it accept gifts gratefully as an expression of love but then treat those things as mine to do with however need to if she gave you something then came around and asked about it and you were just matter of fact love that you were thinking of me when you got that but we did need it so passed in on she might be hurt or react that hers to do but you have done nothing wrong and your relationship is likely to break over it and she might even think twice about the next gadget she wants to pass along to you think my approach helps my relationships with the moms because it allows me to be grateful avoid resentment on my part and be honest with them about who am ie it more real relationship than if tried to pretend it was an issue that what try for anyway good luck my mom sounds similar and had to have heart to heart with her about what kinds of things were appropriate for my kids let her know in no uncertain terms that they have everything they *need and want them to actually use and enjoy the stuff they have rather than swamp them with more than they can handle since then she ll ask me before she buys or sends something for my kids if she already got it and we do want it she does have other grandkids to potentially take it we also have been hinting strongly that we value experiences more than things so gifts of tickets to the zoo or museums or play at the children theater are all very welcome if my husband were an only child would think we had the same mil we have literally no room for anything yet my mil brings bags and bags of stuff evert time she visits she is also addicted to amazon and has stuff delivered for my kid who is now only 11 months this has been going on for while at first told her no more big things because we do have room she apparently has no concept of big so told her she was allowed to buy any toys at all none she came over on sunday with toy car that like the size of loaf of bread and this giant blue stuffed dog thing that you sit on ca describe it but it is ugly and creepy and hate it what does no more toys at all mean my mother has done this for years like the others do have much advice for how to get her to stop have had really direct conversations with her to the point ve hurt her feelings and yet she does not stop ve told her how uncomfortable multiple presents make me feel she does not stop my children have very little in their college fund would have loved it if every time grandma felt the urge to shop she could have just put little in bank account for them but instead have house filled with ridiculous egg slicers and pizzelle makers and puppy purses and educational card games perhaps you could print out this thread and leave it where your mother could see it suggest that she buy one little thing for your daughter like lip gloss or nail polish and put twenty in bank account for later these issues go deep and most people especially older parents are just not willing to confront the things love and shopping addiction that often lies behind this behavior read simplicity parenting it discusses the problem of too much stuff very powerfully in terms of how it negatively impacts children then tell your mil about all the epiphanies you re having from reading it and if possible ask her to read all or parts of it deleted my mil does things like this too hate stuff throw it away or give it away with abandon and she knows this about me she accused us of having throwing things away thing and when the baby was coming she immediately went into bargain bin thrift store whatever can get my hands on overdrive we found solutions one was my husband we have your parents your awkward conversation deal told her in no uncertain terms no more stuff this worked for about months and then she started trickling the stuff in but it usually now just one or two items an outfit or something we do mind taking but we made it clear that we appreciate the thought but we do have room for it and will get rid of it so you re wasting your money and do want our son to just associate his grandma with presents instead of as loving and supportive family member if she came to visit and he greeted her with what you bring me be livid the second thing that saved us was my sister in law my mil baby got pregnant cue evil laughter so now she getting all of it this is exactly what do my ops mil sounds very similar to my mil she means we ll and her excuse is that when her boys were growing up she has sons she could always buy them and she better off now that she can buy stuff mostly it clothes and toys but there are some things that get put aside as something nice if it clothes she gets make it an excuse to go through your closet and clean out older stuff go through everyone closets once year or when start running out of hangers ultimately op make it clear to mil that you do have room for everything and purge when you need to craigslist can be your friend do know if this will work for you but turned well meaning parent from stuff stuffer to college fund donator basically sat down with my mother and told her in the most sincere manner possible that her intentions were good but needed her help another way involved her in setting up 529 college fund let her have copy of the statements and asked her to please donate there every time she had an impulse to buy something also kept updating her and made her part of the savings team it made her feel useful and included every dollar or rolled coin case would help and even turning in things for recyclable change could be donated it worked like charm for me less junk and future savings account for rising college and happy mother just suggestion my mom does this for the kids stuff pretty quickly made rule that all the toys she buys stay at her house occasionally things make it to my house but it is so much better when the clutter is at her house she bought my daughter several winter coats last year too ended up giving those to her neighbor kids warned my mom that if she kept bringing my daughter presents every time she visited that my daughter would take it for granted the very next visit she brought nothing and was greeted with what did you bring me my mom was bit shocked but she finally realized she needed to cut back if someone comes up with the solution to this all ears ve tried heartfelt conversations practical conversations and full on grumpy why do you listen to me when ask you to stop buying things rants my mom is coming tomorrow and has warned me to expect overwhelming quantities of new baby clothes *sigh* edit we ve also straight out told her that things we do want we will return or donate then we follow through has stopped her yet tell me about it my son thinks the mailman is his own personal santa claus ugh wish this worked for my mom she wanted to get my son this gaudy plastic contraption for his first birthday instead offered the choice between wooden trike and wooden push cart they both were just more in line with our family style and did seem so in your face she bought both because she just could choose gaah we are planning to make 529 fund and once we do we will definately be telling people once we have it will ask my husband to sit down and talk to her about directing her impulses towards that thanks think if it got to that point would have box that would put them directly into right in front of her and put it in my trunk for donations my mil is constantly trying to give us things luckily my husband keeps her in check most of the time if she wants to bring something she knows my husband will refuse she calls me instead just flat out nicely tell her no and give her heads up if getting rid of something she gave us she always wants everything back lol geez that madness have mom who smokes like train and no matter how nicely or rudely tell her the things that she brings in smell awful and go in the trash she continues to bring stuff ugh can you rechannel her generosity for example we just do have room in our little apartment so we requested experiences instead they have contributed year long passes to the aquarium for the family ballet lessons etc then be sure to send lots of photos and emails of how much you are enjoying their generosity my mil does the same things the thing is she does it on purpose so we ve had to start being not so nice about it it started with the baby shower and her buying things similar to the stuff on my registry but total crap here neon green diaper bag with giraffe on it and not the nice one you wanted so we took everything back she pouted about it then she started buying tons of electronic toys from yardsales am picky with toys and think they need to be simple and serve purpose so we got rid of all of them started to specify educational toys so that brought more vtech toys argh those were gone in week then we went clothes shopping with her once she held up pair of clearance jeans that were size 4t my daughter was months the jeans were ugly frayed bottoms and holes everywhere looked worn and terrible both my husband and said no no jeans that have holes plus we re pentecostal mil is so while my daughter wears pants for now she probably wo always mil threw complete fit and said she will keep jeans like that at her house for my daughter to wear wtf she now trying to move to our town and mentioned recently that she bought bunch of jeans for our daughter and has them at her house so she doing this on purpose and wants to do the opposite of whatever say anyway just stand your ground and be consistent and on the same page with your hubby it works for us she gets mad but keeps buying crap and we keep throwing it out and she gets mad all over again give zero cares anymore my house my child my rules yuck that rough at least the stuff she buys is useable even if it is obnoxious know she coming from place of love which makes it that much harder for her to understand how it feels like she disregarding our wishes and why we re frustrated trust me we ve considered it we know she keeps buying stuff because it her way of showing her love which is nice…but complicated as you well know it hard to balance her need to show her love with our desire to have our wishes respected in the end know there are worse problems to have maybe it conversation that your husband can lead we both try to manage our parents respectively so even on an issue like getting put on group text by my mil the other day with ten other people dh was the one to go hey mom you re blowing up our phones it sounds lot better coming from him even though made the first complaint to him you can always pass it along later it hard for them to get it wow you sound almost exactly like me and my mother her husband my dad makes very good money yet she insists on buying the cheapest most generic stuff from walmart or dollar general fine if that what she wants for herself but we do want cheap synthetic tacky clothes for our kids or poorly made flimsy gimmicky toys that she constantly buying them christmas is the worst she ll ask what we want and then somehow find the worst cheapest version if it other people suggested making 529 plan or another plan that people outside can put money into for your child college maybe if you do this she and let her know how much it will help your child future it will give her different outlet oh it is definately something he is going to lead he knows this is he rule he has decided he is definately going to be more forward with her when she gets stuff we really do need hopefully it will be done delicately enough that she wo get too upset by it lol she already started one telling you this woman is unstoppable appreciate all these suggestions though there got to be one or two that might work once my bee is little older this will definately be route to take may mention how we are considering taking her to swimming lessons very soon yep lot of the toys get donated at least she gotten better about texting me pictures of clothes before she buys them…sometimes yes always buying the cheapest knock off version of everything so annoying also liked the experiences thing someone suggested we belong to the fine art museum where take the little bee for art classes yes they have infant ones which are more for the adults think told hubby that he can suggest gift certificate from there to go towards her classes or maybe pay for some swimming lessons since want to start her early or even romp roll which is too expensive for us as sahm this will help us tons since she is in daycare and am struggling at her age to get her around other kids oh lord the clothing thankfully my mil and sil have decent taste but the amount of clothing our 3yo has worn is embarrassing after you do it the first time it becomes lot easier never thought it would happen but my mil will now ask hey could lo use some and ll say no but if you re out and see good deal on that would be great we are really low so glad we had that first awkward conversation but things are great now and mil is actually huge help harness the power of your mil buying to fill the gaps in lo wardrobe diapers snacks etc also snowsuits had to echo the wtf because wow lol sigh do understand those blankets and the older my mum gets the shorter she gets and the worse this blanket problem is going to get
